greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of compositions into nonzero parts with k parts directly followed by a different part, n>=0, 0<=k<=n.
comment: First column (k=0) is A000005, second column (k=1) is 2*A002133.
link: Joerg Arndt and Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
example: Row 5 is [2, 10, 4, 0, 0, 0] because in the 16 compositions of 5
there are 2 with no changes, 10 with one change, and 4 with two changes.
maple: b:= proc(n, v) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, expand(
add(b(n-i, i)*`if`(v=0 or v=i, 1, x), i=1..n)))
T:= n-> seq(coeff(b(n, 0), x, i), i=0..n):
mathematica: b[n_, v_] := b[n, v] = If[n == 0, 1, Sum[b[n-i, i]*If[v == 0 || v == i, 1, x], {i, 1, n}]]; T[n_] := Table[Coefficient[b[n, 0], x, i], {i, 0, n}]; Table[T[n], {n, 0, 14}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 12 2015, translated from Maple *)
xref: Cf. A238279 (same sequence with zeros omitted).
Cf. A106356 (compositions with k successive parts same).
Cf. A225084 (compositions with maximal up-step k).
results.author: _Joerg Arndt_ and _Alois P. Heinz_, Feb 21 2014
